sn45.7:4.2: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha …
sn45.7:5.1: “Sir, they speak of ‘the removal of greed, hate, and delusion’.
sn45.7:5.2: What is this a term for?”
sn45.7:5.4: “Mendicant, the removal of greed, hate, and delusion is a term for the element of extinguishment.
sn45.7:5.6: It’s used to speak of the ending of defilements.”
sn45.7:6.1: When he said this, the mendicant said to the Buddha:
sn45.7:6.3: What is the deathless? And what is the path that leads to the deathless?”
sn45.7:6.4: “The ending of greed, hate, and delusion.
sn45.7:6.6: The path that leads to the deathless is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn45.7:6.7: right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right samādhi.”
